definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: And then I tried to cheer up and began thinking about improving my English level.
sentences.chinese: 然后，强打精神，开始思考提高自己的英文水准。

sentences.english: Hearing that his mother had died, John gathered himself together and said he wanted a drink.
sentences.chinese: 听说母亲去世，约翰强打精神，并说想喝上一杯。

definition: to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to return a compliment/to give sth in return
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to fight desperately (at the risk of one's life)
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
to collude with/to collaborate/(basketball) hook shot
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
